intro: Moraea monticola, commonly known as the mountain moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea monticola is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
